text:
What we have here at the museum
today is actually a prototype

vehicle of what a potential
Mars rover capable of

supporting a human mission to
Mars might look like.

If you look at the wheels that
are on board this vehicle you have

these very large, very wide, round wheels.
They're intentionally designed that way

so they sort of float 
on the Martian soil.

The vehicle is actually two
vehicles in one. There's the forward

cab area, which actually can
disconnect and separate

in the middle and leave behind the
back module which can be

configured as a habitation
module, or a laboratory
or all sorts of different purposes.

While the forward front end
drives around, explores and then

comes back, reconnects with it
and then the entire unit

It actually is an electric, solar 
powered vehicle that you would

be able to use on the surface 
of Mars.

This particular vehicle would 
never actually fly to Mars.

Itâ€™s definitely designed to be
an Earth-bound concept.
